style.name: American-Style Dark Lager
style.description: This beer's malt aroma and flavor are low but notable. Its color ranges from a very deep copper to a deep, dark brown. It has a clean, light body with discreet contributions from caramel and roasted malts. Non-malt adjuncts are often used, and hop rates are low. Hop bitterness is clean and has a short duration of impact. Hop flavor, and aroma are low. Carbonation is high. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
breweries.description:
Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997.

Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent.
 
Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.

data.name: Saranac Chocolate Amber
data.description: There comes a time every year in the Adirondacks when a heavier, more malty brew compliments the cold winter months. This brew showcases a variety of dark roasted malts, producing a beer with a rich chocolaty flavor.

breweries.name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
breweries.description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

breweries.name: August Schell Brewing Company
breweries.description: The August Schell Brewing Company is a brewing company in New Ulm, Minnesota. It was founded by German immigrants August Schell and Jacob Bernhardt in 1860 and passed into the possession of the Schell family in 1866. It is the second oldest family-owned brewery in America and became the oldest and largest brewery in Minnesota when the company bought the Grain Belt rights in 2002.

data.name: Schwarzberry
data.description: This Schwarzbier (black lager) was made with our house lager yeast and debittered black malt to make a smooth, roasty base beer. We add a ½ lb per gallon of blackberries to give a subtle hint of tart fruit.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

data.name: Senor Viejo
data.description: This Schwarzbier has been "imperialized" (alcohol content increased) and then left to age in tequila barrels (used Jack Daniels barrels which are then used by Republic Tequila to age there tequila to Repasado or Anejo styles). Aging this unique beer in tequila barrels adds subtle flavors of vanilla and oak while the tequila adds a mild citrus/agave sweetness. At 8.2% alcohol by volume Senor Viejo is our strongest, most seasoned beer.

data.name: Shiner Bohemian Black Lager
data.description: Bohemian Black Lager, crafted according to exacting old-world standards with imported Czech Saaz, Styrians Hops and selected roasted malts, is the darkest beer we brew. Initially added to the Shiner family as our 97 Anniversary Brew, the unique and complex flavor of this rare brew found such a following among our customers that we brought it back for good!

breweries.name: Spoetzl Brewery
breweries.description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.

breweries.name: Blue Star Brewing Company
breweries.description: Owned and operated by Joey and Maggie Villarreal of Joey's on N. St. Mary's Street, the BSBC has been open since June 25, 1996. We offer medal-winning beers, an exceptional wine list, and delicious food. The brew pub is located in the Blue Star Arts Complex at 1414 S. Alamo, on the San Antonio river across the street from the Pioneer flour mill. The stainless steel vats and brewing facility are right at home in what was once an old beer storage warehouse. Friendly staff and warm wood decor make for a comfortable, casual atmosphere.

data.name: SOUL
data.description:
Welcome to the darkness of
 the center of the beer universe.
 Soul is a dark lager intended to
 reach inside of you and grapple
 with your very existence. The
 roasted finish of this 4.9% ABV
 anomaly is like the dark matter
 that haunts space travelers,
 aquanauts, kindergarten teachers,
 and the criminally insane,
 driving each of them into a fit of
 pleasure, as the cool refreshment
 washes away their fears.
 Embrace the darkness.

breweries.name: Mayday Brewery
breweries.description: Mayday Brewery opened 11/30/2012 in an abandoned blanket factory built in 1923. Mayday's 900 sq ft tasting room is the original boiler room for the blanket factory. Mayday has another 600 sq ft of bar area and a large outside deck. Mayday packages beer for distribution and their tasting room is open Thurs-Friday 4-8 and Saturday 1-8. Brewery tours are offered Saturday on the hour from 2:00-6:00. At Mayday our motto is, "We try NOT to suck."

data.name: Vale /Drk
data.description: Designed using pale, munich, crystal and carafa roasted malt. a filtered beer with brilliant clarity, dark brown in color with ruby and garnet highlights. it has a strong malt backbone with hints of coffee, chocolate and cocoa that balance the use of falconer’s flight hops, giving rise to citrus, pine and vanilla flavors and aromas. the combination of dark malt and hops with lager yeast delivering a crisp, clean dark beer.

breweries.name: McLaren Vale Beer Company
breweries.description:
McLaren Vale Beer Company was founded by a couple of Craft Beer loving, proud South Australian mates, who enjoyed decades of heading down to the Vale from Adelaide for summer holidays and long weekends. Being lovers of great food and beverage and local produce, the rich tapestry of McLaren Vale always delivered. As the boys got to know the wine community and gained a deeper understanding of the region, they realised there was a tremendous opportunity for a beer producer to add another dimension to the local offering. Beer has long been a popular post-work refreshment for the wine community and we like to think that behind every great wine is great beer.
Us South Aussies are spoilt for choice when it comes to great food, beverage and produce. We have an appreciation for the good things in life, having grown up with such quality at our fingertips. This is the reason we started a beer company in this great state. We feel at home here and with that comes a responsibility to play a part in the great food and beverage offering.

data.name: Vojtech
data.description:
Half dark lager 12° of Bavarian type with 5,4 % content of alcohol brewed from three kinds of malt.
It contains: water, barley light malt, Bavarian malt, caramel malt, hops from Žatec.
Characteristics: rich amber colour and caramel aroma.
Flavour: slightly bitter with caramel touch.

breweries.name: Pivovar hotel Na Rychtě
breweries.description:
This storied hotel with a brewery dating from the 19th century is a 3-minute walk from the Usti nad Labem train station and 2.9 km from the Střekov Castle. 

The simple rooms with refined furniture, parquet floors and photographs of the historic venue also feature free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. Kids ages 3 and younger are welcome without charge.

Freebies include parking, a breakfast buffet and beer. A rustic-chic restaurant/bar and brewery features arched ceilings and shaded outdoor seating. Brewery tours are available. Other amenities include bike storage and cleaning facilities. Pets are welcome.

data.name: Waterloo Dark
data.description: Brewed with specialty Canadian malts, imported hops and pure cultured brewer’s yeast, Waterloo Dark has been recognized and honored multiple times for its superior quality and craftsmanship at the World Beer Cup, Canadian and Ontario Brewing Awards, and the Monde Selection International Institute for Quality Selections.
data.foodPairings: Dark lagers are enjoyed all year long, and they’re not as filling as ales. Beef dishes go especially well with Waterloo Dark. This lager’s roasted malt character allows your taste buds to enjoy the rich flavour of that perfectly cooked top sirloin steak. Waterloo Dark will cut some of the heaviness in sauce-based pork rib dishes as well.

Malts: Black Patent, Caramel, Chocolate, Pale
Hops: Cascade, Chinook, Mt. Hood, Tettnanger

breweries.name: Beach Haus Brewery
breweries.description:
Established in 2007, Belmar, New Jersey based Beach Haus Brewery was founded by passionate individuals with a belief that the great American traditions of creativity, diversity, and accessibility apply equally to building a great beer company. 

Originally founded out of the co-founders garage, Beach Haus beers are now proudly brewed out of Belmar, NJ since December 2014.

breweries.name: Wolverine State Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are the proud brewers of Michigan's Most Drinkable Beers. We are the only microbrewery in Michigan that specializes in making lagers for everyone. What does this mean? It means that from light to dark, every beer we brew is designed to be a beer you can love.
